description: Backbone's only hard dependency. [[http://underscorejs.org]]
title: Underscore.js

description: Needed if you'd like to parse and serialize JSON in older browsers (read: "Internet Explorer") [[https://github.com/douglascrockford/JSON-js]]
title: JSON2.js

description: Recommended for DOM manipulation and Ajax. [[http://jquery.com]]
title: jQuery

description: A performance-minded Underscore alternative with customs builds and additional features. [[http://lodash.com/]]
title: Lo-Dash

description: A jQuery alternative for mobile apps [[http://zeptojs.com]]  *NB: Zepto isn't fully compatible with jQuery, use at your own risk*
title: Zepto

description: A tiny drop-in replacement for jQuery to allow Backbone to work while relying on only native DOM APIs. [[https://github.com/inkling/backbone.native]]
title: Backbone.Native

description: * Allows you to get and set your attributes on a model using a jQuery like api * [[https://github.com/rhysbrettbowen/Backbone.ModelAttrs]]
title: Backbone.ModelAttrs

description: * Create a new model with computed properties from an existing model and a schema that keeps itself up to date (great to use as a serialized model for templates - separates original model and computed properties while still being reactive). * [[https://github.com/rhysbrettbowen/Backbone.ModelMorph]]
title: Backbone.ModelMorph

description: * The plugin help you to define schema of a model. It supports simple types, arrays, nested or reference models/collections, allow to define custom data types and computable properties. * [[https://github.com/DreamTheater/Backbone.Schema]]
title: Backbone.Schema

description: Generate customisable forms from your model schema. Features include custom editors, nested forms, editable lists and validation.  * [[https://github.com/powmedia/backbone-forms]]
title: Backbone Forms

description: Improved support for models with nested attributes. Get and set attributes and listen to changes on them using a path, e.g. get('user.address.ln1').  * [[https://github.com/powmedia/backbone-deep-model]]
title: backbone-deep-model

description: A plugin to make Backbone keep track of nested attributes.  * [[http://afeld.github.com/backbone-nested/]]
title: Backbone-Nested

description: Create undo points to store / restore your model's state.  Get the code and read the documentation:  * [[https://github.com/derickbailey/backbone.memento]]
title: Backbone.Memento

description: [Memento pattern](http://sourcemaking.com/design_patterns/memento) realization for Backbone.js models with more flexible API than in Backbone.Memento  * [[https://github.com/iVariable/Backbone.actAs.Mementoable]]
title: Backbone.actAs.Mementoable

description: Simple helpers to configure your models from one configuration object.  * [[https://github.com/iVariable/Backbone.actAs.Configurable]]
title: Backbone.actAs.Configurable

description: * Provides per-attribute serialization and deserialization (using Underscore-Awesomer's _.toJSON and _.parseJSON functions). * Useful for client-side localized string lookups, custom Date storage (for CouchDB views), attribute validations, and much more! * [[https://github.com/kmalakoff/backbone-articulation]] * [[https://github.com/kmalakoff/underscore-awesomer]]
title: Backbone.Articulation

description: * Validations are declared on the model * Conventionally updates your html with error classes and error messages * Easy to extend with custom validators * [[http://github.com/thedersen/backbone.validation]]
title: Backbone.Validation

description: * Validations are declared on the model * Easy to extend with custom validators * Provides the replacement of out-of-range values with data from the defaults hash * [[http://github.com/toddself/Backbone.Validator]]
title: Backbone.Validator

description: * Standalone validator * Easy to attach validation to views * Extendable built-in validators * [Example](http://jsfiddle.net/fantactuka/6zh5y/): Model validation (with nested attributes) & data binding using [Backbone.Validator](https://github.com/fantactuka/backbone-validator) + [Backbone.Stickit](https://github.com/nytimes/backbone.stickit) + [Backbone.Ext](https://github.com/fantactuka/backbone-ext) * [[https://github.com/fantactuka/backbone-validator]]
title: Backbone.Validator

description: * Store view related attributes on a Backbone.ViewModel and keep your Backbone.Model to persistance/state attributes * [[http://github.com/tommyh/backbone-view-model]]
title: backbone-view-model

description: * Lets you build your views while you wait for models to load. * Notifies you when a model unloads so you can change your view state. * Compatible with Knockback.js ([[https://github.com/kmalakoff/knockback]])  Pretty much just a collection and model id reference. Simple, but useful. * [[https://github.com/kmalakoff/backbone-modelref]]
title: Backbone.ModelRef

description: * Finite-state machine (FSM) for for Backbone.Model. Elegant syntax, and very short. Patterned after the Ruby [workflow gem](https://github.com/geekq/workflow). * [[https://github.com/kendagriff/workflow.js]]
title: workflow.js

description: * Lets you model attributes with dot-syntax. * e.g. song.get('album.title') * [[https://github.com/amccloud/backbone-dotattr]]
title: Backbone Dotattr

description: * Enables you to override getters and setters with logic * [[https://github.com/asciidisco/Backbone.Mutators]]
title: Backbone.Mutators

description: * One Collection, different model objects, mapped easy via configuration * [[https://github.com/asciidisco/Backbone.Chosen]]
title: Backbone.Chosen

description: * Cache calls to `fetch` in memory and localStorage. Handy when you don't control the cache headers on the API you're calling. * [[https://github.com/mrappleton/backbone-fetch-cache]]
title: Backbone fetch cache

description: * Ensures unique model instances inside a Backbone app. Can optionally sync models across windows using localStorage. * [[https://github.com/disqus/backbone.uniquemodel]]
title: Backbone.UniqueModel

description: * Adds a toggle method to `Backbone.Model` to easily toggle attribute values. * [[https://github.com/todd/backbone.model.toggle]]
title: Backbone.Model.toggle

description: * Client-side id generator for Backbone.Model. * [[https://github.com/ask11/backbone-id]]
title: Backbone.Id

description: * LocalStorage adapter that overrides Backbone.Sync * [[https://github.com/jeromegn/Backbone.localStorage]]
title: Backbone.localStorage

description: * Making it easy to use backbone with couchdb. * [[https://github.com/pyronicide/backbone.couchdb.js]]
title: backbone.couchdb.js

description: * Bind Socket.io events to backbone models & collections. * Includes optional replacement for Backbone.sync for use with Socket.io. * [[https://github.com/logicalparadox/backbone.iobind]]
title: Backbone.ioBind

description: * WebSQL adapter that overrides Backbone.sync * [[https://github.com/MarrLiss/backbone-websql]]
title: Backbone-websql

description: * Get and set local variables that won't persist on save() calls * [[https://github.com/itsjoesullivan/Backbone.slet]]
title: Backbone-slet

description: * Work with SharePoint items and list as Backbone Models and Collections. * [[https://github.com/lstak/Backbone.SharePoint]]
title: Backbone.SharePoint

description: * Connect to SAP business data through SAP Gateway. * [[https://github.com/lstak/Backbone.SAP]]
title: Backbone.SAP

description: * Allows your Backbone.js app to work offline * [[https://github.com/Ask11/backbone.offline]]
title: Backbone.Offline

description: * Allows your Backbone.js app to fetch and store data based on the JSON-RPC protocol * [[https://github.com/asciidisco/Backbone.Rpc]]
title: Backbone.Rpc

description: * Allows your Backbone.js app to store data in local storage when using 'set', as well as reloading on recreation with the same local storage key. * [[https://github.com/orizens/Backbone.Safe]]
title: Backbone.Safe

description: * Overrides Backbone.Sync, and allows fetching from remote servers, localstorage, and an in-memory store. * Allows custom data stores to be added (planned: load data from a js config file). * Can combine data from multiple sources at fetch time. * [[https://github.com/nicoburns/Backbone.Flexisync]]
title: Backbone.Flexisync

description: * Provides models that support MongoDB Extended JSON format. * Overrides Backbone.parse and Backbone.sync. * Can be easily used with [[http://mongolab.com]]. * [[http://github.com/dealancer/backbone-mongodb]]
title: Backbone-mongodb

description: * Get and set relations (one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-one) for Backbone models * [[https://github.com/PaulUithol/Backbone-relational]]
title: Backbone-relational

description: * Provides a lightweight and performant implementation of setting up associations between Backbone models * [[https://github.com/dhruvaray/backbone-associations]]
title: Backbone-associations

description: * [[https://github.com/masylum/Backbone.Rel]]
title: Backbone.Rel

description: * Relational associations for Backbone * [[https://github.com/dbrady/ligament.js]]
title: Ligament

description: * [[https://github.com/juggy/backbone-orm]]
title: backbone-orm

description: * Add Rails-like nested attributes support for Backbone.Model * [[https://github.com/dtmconsultoria/backbone-nested-attributes]]
title: Backbone.NestedAttributes

description: * Register collections to share model instances * [[https://github.com/rhysbrettbowen/Backbone.ModelRegistry]]
title: Backbone.ModelRegistry

description: A pageable, drop-in replacement for Backbone.Collection. Supports client-side and server-side pagination,  single page and global sorting, and client-side bi-directional event handling. Inspired by Backbone.Paginator, but much better. * [[https://github.com/wyuenho/backbone-pageable]]
title: backbone-pageable

description: Capped Collections for BackboneJS. * [[https://github.com/FGRibreau/backbone-cappedcollection]]
title: backbone-cappedcollection

description: Load your collections piece by piece. Very useful for large model sets. * [[https://github.com/iVariable/Backbone.actAs.Paginatable]]
title: Backbone.actAs.Paginatable

description: Simple helper function that makes it easy to work with nested Backbone collections * Source: [[https://gist.github.com/1610397]]
title: Nesting.js

description: Create subsets of collections using filter functions that automatically update allowing you to create a tree of collections that is always in sync. * [[https://github.com/anthonyshort/backbone.collectionsubset]]
title: Backbone.CollectionSubset

description: Provides NoSQL queries (like MongoDB) for backbone.js collections * good readme documentation * runs on node.js and in the browser * [[https://github.com/davidgtonge/backbone_query]]
title: Backbone Query

description: Provides extensive querying, filtering, and searching functionality for backbone.js collections * includes live interactive demo * source-code documentation only * runs on node.js and in the browser * supports NoSQL queries (like MongoDB) * supports filters (applying a filter function to a collection) * supports search strings (useful for turning search input fields into useful queries) * supports pills for search strings (e.g. `author:ben priority:important`) * supports optional live collections (when a model is changed, added or removed, it can automatically be tested against the collections queries, filters, and search string, if it fails, remove it from the collection) * supports parent and child collections (when a parent collection has a model removed, it is removed from the child collection too, when a parent collection has a model added or changed, it is retested against the child collection) * [[https://github.com/bevry/query-engine]]
title: Query Engine

description: * Cache calls to `fetch` in memory and localStorage. Handy when you don't control the cache headers on the API you're calling. * [[https://github.com/mrappleton/backbone-fetch-cache]]
title: Backbone fetch cache

description: Provides filtering of Backbone collections using facets * [[https://github.com/arillo/Backbone.Facetr]]
title: Backbone.Facetr

description: * Implements projections for Backbone.Collections. A projection for a collection is an another collection which contains a subset of models from an underlying collection and stays in sync with it. * By default projections maintain an order induced by underlying collection but an order can be customized with a comparator * Provides `CappedCollection` projection, a projection restricted by a number of elements * Provides `FilteredCollection` projection, a projection restricted by some predicate * Projections can be composed * [[https://github.com/andreypopp/backbone.projections]]
title: Backbone.Projections

description: * The plugin implements a bidirectional data binding between views and models/collections. * [[https://github.com/DreamTheater/Backbone.DataBinding]]
title: Backbone.DataBinding

description: Render Backbone.js collections with ease.  * In addition to managing model views, this class supports automatic selection of models in response to clicks, and reordering models via drag and drop. * Project: http://rotundasoftware.github.io/backbone.collectionView
title: Backbone.CollectionView

description: based on Closure Library's goog.ui.Component * Source: [[https://github.com/rhysbrettbowen/Backbone.ComponentView]]
title: Backbone.ComponentView

description: * A layout and template manager for Backbone.js applications. * Source: [[https://github.com/tbranyen/backbone.layoutmanager]] * Docs: [[http://layoutmanager.org]]
title: LayoutManager

description: An alternative Events implementation for the Backbone.View which provides events which bubble up through a view hierarchy while the latter is inferred from the DOM and the views' position in it.  * Installable via bower: `bower install backbone.viewevents` * Project: https://github.com/andreypopp/backbone.viewevents
title: Backbone.ViewEvents

description: Easily bubble events up your view hierarchy.  * Provides an intuitive message path through which views can communicate, free of explicit dependencies. * Project: https://github.com/rotundasoftware/backbone.courier
title: Backbone.Courier

description: A minimalist view mixin for creating and managing subviews in your Backbone.js applications.  * Use a clear and consistent syntax to insert subviews in your templates. * Can be mixed into any view class, including the base views in Marionette, LayoutManager, etc. * Project: https://github.com/rotundasoftware/backbone.subviews
title: Backbone.Subviews

description: Model-View binding in Backbone style.  * JavaScript configuration - clean up your templates. * Seamlessly integrates into the lifecycle and style of Backbone Views. * Read More: [[http://nytimes.github.com/backbone.stickit/]] * Source: [[https://github.com/NYTimes/backbone.stickit]]
title: Backbone.Stickit

description: * Data binding that's designed to feel familiar to Backbone users * Examples: http://tantaman.github.com/yabbe/examples/YabbeViewExamples.html * Project: https://github.com/tantaman/yabbe
title: Yabbe (Yet Another Backbone Binding Exension)

description: * Data binding between any object, bundled support for Backbone views, models, jQuery (and thus DOM elements or via CSS selectors), Zepto and plain objects (plain objects can only observe) * Use `new Synapse(object)` to return a Synapse object or leave off the `new` and it will return the `object` with `observe`, `notify` and `sync` methods for more transparent usage. * Define your own hooks for custom behavior or to support other types of objects * Minimal example: [[https://github.com/bruth/synapse/blob/master/src/synapse/hooks/object.coffee]] * Robust example: [[https://github.com/bruth/synapse/blob/master/src/synapse/hooks/jquery.coffee]] * Docs here: [[https://github.com/bruth/synapse/blob/master/src/synapse/hooks/README.md]] * Register your hooks `Synapse.addHooks(hook1, hook2, hook3, ...)`  * Source: [[https://github.com/bruth/synapse]] * Docs & Examples: [[http://bruth.github.com/synapse/docs/]] * Interactive Demo: [[http://jsfiddle.net/bruth/bufeK/]]
title: Synapse

description: Simple, flexible and powerful bidirectional view-model binding for backbone. A javascript only solution (no markup in html) that relies on jQuery delegates for binding. Similar to how backbone view event blocks work.  * Handles partial view binding, nested views, formatting, type conversion, arbitrary html attributes and most html element types. * [JS Weekly Article](https://github.com/theironcook/Backbone.ModelBinder/wiki/A-Simple-But-Powerful-Backbone-View-Model-Binder-:-Javascript-Weekly-April-13th.) * [Git](https://github.com/theironcook/Backbone.ModelBinder)
title: Backbone.ModelBinder.js

description: Bi-directional bindings between Backbone.View elements and Backbone.Model attributes.  * Simple binding definitions like Backbone.View.events * Bind to any element with by selector * Bi-directional transformation * Tested * [[https://github.com/amccloud/backbone-bindings]]
title: Backbone Bindings

description: Awesome model binding between models and form input elements, and more  * KnockoutJS-style `data-bind` attribute support * Bind form fields to models and vice-versa * Convention based * Pluggable with your own conventions * Extensible to bind to more than just form input elements  Get the code and read the documentation:  * [[https://github.com/derickbailey/backbone.modelbinding]]
title: Backbone.ModelBinding

description: Knockout bindings for Backbone.js models and collections.  * includes localization hooks * integrates with Backbone.ModelRef ([[https://github.com/kmalakoff/backbone-modelref]]) for lazy loading scenarios  * Github: [[https://github.com/kmalakoff/knockback]] * jsFiddle sample: [[http://jsfiddle.net/kmalakoff/QSkpv/]]
title: Knockback.js

description: A little plugin for use in leanback apps, where someone is sat on the couch using a remote control to use your app.  * Simple use - keypad.bind("key:up", function(){//do something on up}); * Events can be triggered on anything that extends Backbone.Events * Extensible to capture other key events * [[http://tomphilip.me/index.php/backbone-on-the-couch/]]
title: Backbone on the Couch

description: Plugin that proxies jQuery/Zepto/$ functions for Backbone Views.  * [https://github.com/h4rry/backbone-proxyDollar](https://github.com/h4rry/backbone-proxyDollar)
title: ProxyDollar

description: A small plugin that adds declarative model and collection event binding to Backbone Views.  * [[https://github.com/Codecademy/backbone.declarative]] * Tested and passes all Backbone tests.
title: Backbone.declarative

description: KnockoutJS-inspired declarative binding solution for Backbone Views.  * KnockoutJS-compatible binding handler API * Explicit control over dependencies (e.g. cascading select boxes) * Unobtrusive (i.e. code-based) and declarative (i.e. markup-based) configuration * Multiple binding contexts for separating transient and persistent models. * Tests, TodosMVC, and examples. * [[https://github.com/politician/outback]]
title: outback.js

description: Extension for automatic binding and unbinding of model events to views. It defines two special view attributes  - bindToModel and bindToCollection. They are handled similar to events attribute, but instead of binding to dom events they bind to model/collection. Also this plugin takes care of cleaning events after the view is removed.  [[https://github.com/RStankov/backbone-bind-to]]
title: Backbone.BindTo

description: Make jQuery widgets/plugins from your Backbone Views.  * Create Backbone.Views with jQuery syntax: `$('.example').myView([options])` * http://meleyal.github.io/backbone.widget/
title: Backbone.Widget

description: View management and transitions geared toward mobile applications.  * manage multiple views through a single "view port" * create stacks of views and selectable lists of views * transition between views (slide, fade, etc.) * https://github.com/scttnlsn/backbone.viewkit
title: Backbone.ViewKit

description: [[http://andreypopp.github.com/backbone.viewdsl/]] or install via bower `bower install backbone.viewdsl`  Backbone.ViewDSL is a tiny library which provides a DSL for defining Backbone.View hierarchies. If you are tired of manually composing views in your Backbone application and want to get rid of all accompanying boilerplate then this library could help a bit.  Backbone.ViewDSL provides a DSL built on top of HTML with the following features: * view instantiation (optionally loaded from AMD modules) * conditional exclusion of DOM elements from a final result * string and DOM node values interpolation
title: Backbone.ViewDSL

description: It is an extension for Backbone.View, which adds views management logic and structure. It's common for a view to have multiple subviews, but in Backbone.View managing subviews has to be done manually. This extension manages rendering a view and its subviews. When a view is removed, this extension also manages the subviews removal.  [[https://github.com/steverandy/backbone.managedview]]
title: backbone.managedview

description: Global notification mechanism for Backbone.  - Source: [[https://github.com/fatiherikli/backbone-notifications]] - Demo: [[http://fatiherikli.github.com/backbone-notifications/]]
title: Backbone.Notifications

description: Monkey patch Backbone.View to enable fast tap events on touch devices.  [[https://github.com/nervetattoo/backbone.touch]]
title: Backbone.touch

description: Easily add keyboard support in your Backbone views  [[https://github.com/nervetattoo/backbone.keys]]
title: Backbone.keys

description: Backbone on steroids : super lightweight Backbone extension that provides boilerplates Views to write dramatically less code  [[http://baguette.io]]
title: Backbone Baguette

description: Declare a chain of callbacks for a particular event declaration in the View  * this is a mixin, thus it simply extends the `Backbone.View` class you're already using * there's a [Rails 3 gem](http://github.com/simsalabim/backbone-view-enhanced-events-declaration-rails) for the mixin * http://github.com/simsalabim/backbone.view.enhanced_events_declaration
title: Backbone View Enhanced Events Declaration

description: * [[https://github.com/juggy/backrub]] * Uses Handlebars.js and Backbone.View to keep your template updated on the page. Based on Sproutcore TemplateView.
title: Backrub

description: * Source: [[https://github.com/creationix/dombuilder]]
title: Builder (DOM Builder for Backbone Views)

description: * `Backbone.*.super`, `Backbone.*.create` — useful shortcuts for class/instances * `Backbone.Helpers.flatten`, `Backbone.Helpers.unflatten` to work with nested objects (mostly for model nested attributes) * Source: [[https://github.com/fantactuka/backbone-ext]]
title: Backbone.Ext

description: Provides a general purpose Event Broker implementation for Backbone based on the Backbone Events API. * Source: [[https://github.com/efeminella/backbone-eventbroker]]
title: Backbone.EventBroker

description: jQuery style namespacing ([[http://docs.jquery.com/Namespaced_Events]]) of Backbone's Events object * Source: [[https://github.com/wheresrhys/backbone.namespaced-events]]
title: Namespaced Events

description: Use delimited notation to reorganize the flat Backbone event stack into a nested hierarchy in order to allow easier implementation of grouped event actions. * Source: [[https://github.com/holt/backbone-structured-events]]
title: backbone-structured-events

description: A semantic, easily stylable, light weight and yet extremely flexible set of widgets for building data grids. * Source: [[https://github.com/wyuenho/backgrid]] * Documentation: [[http://wyuenho.github.com/backgrid/]]
title: Backgrid

description: * Source: [[http://github.com/teleological/slickback]] * Example: [[http://teleological.github.com/slickback]] * Documentation: [[https://github.com/teleological/slickback/wiki]]
title: Slickback (integration with SlickGrid)

description: That's an extendable grid system (jqGrid like) developed on Backbone, Twitter Bootstrap and jQuery. * Source: [[http://github.com/direct-fuel-injection/bbGrid]] * Documentation && Examples: [[http://direct-fuel-injection.github.com/bbGrid]]
title: bbGrid

description: * Homepage: [[http://wiki.iks-project.eu/index.php/VIE]] * Annotated Source: [[http://bergie.github.com/VIE/]]
title: Vienna IKS Editables

description: Backbone.Aura is a decoupled, event-driven architecture on top of Backbone.js for developing widget-based applications * Homepage: [[http://addyosmani.github.com/aura/]] * Source: [[https://github.com/addyosmani/aura]]
title: Backbone.Aura

description: This is not framework. It's just Backbone.js + Require.js + CoffeeScript application structure.  https://github.com/artyomtrityak/backbone-package-template
title: Backbone Package Template

description: * [[https://github.com/azicchetti/jquerymobile-router]] - a replacement for Backbone's routing, which is compatible with jQuery Mobile
title: jQuery Mobile Routing

description: * [[https://github.com/angelo0000/backbone_filters]] - provide Rails-like before & after filters on your Routers; especially useful for user access control * [[https://github.com/boazsender/backbone.routefilter]] - Before and after filters for Backbone.Router. Similar idea to backbone_filters above, but takes a different approach, and has a different API. * [[https://github.com/fantactuka/backbone-route-filter]] - Before/after filters for Backbone.Router. Coupled with Backbone's test suite to make sure it does not break anything. * [[https://github.com/mojotech/backbone.routerFilters]] - Rails inspired before and after filters your routers. Can be controlled like Rails with `only` and `except`.
title: Before/After Filters

description: * [[https://github.com/jhudson8/backbone-query-parameters]] - provides query parameter support to backbone routes; especially useful for routes with optional parameters.  Traditional parameters *can* be used in conjunction with query parameters.
title: Query Parameters

description: * [[https://github.com/kr1zmo/backbone-query-string]] - A lightweight extension of Backbone.Router that defines a constructor-function/sub-class that can be utilized separately not affecting Backbone.Router. It will supply a query-string object in route callbacks. Currently, supports AMD (requirejs).
title: Query-String

description: * [[https://github.com/michael-lefebvre/Backbone-AppRouter]] - Extends Backbone.Router to find back a route pattern and construct an URL with arguments.
title: AppRouter

description: * [[https://github.com/tbranyen/backbone-boilerplate]] - A set of best practices and utilities for building Backbone.js applications
title: Backbone Boilerplate

description: * [[https://github.com/jamuhl/backbone.CQRS]] - Backbone extension to provide CQRS integration down to clientside
title: Backbone.CQRS

description: * [[http://bennolan.com/2010/12/13/capt-a-tool-for-backbone.html]]
title: Capt by Ben Nolan

description: * [[https://github.com/chaplinjs/chaplin]] - An opinionated, full-featured architecture framework for creating complex single-page applications with a strong emphasis on memory management and class heirarchies. Includes a powerful CollectionView class, rails-style routing with proper params hash, and controller patterns.
title: Chaplin

description: Make your BackboneJS apps dance with a composite application structure!  * Better application startup structure through application initializers * Built in event aggregator, for convenient application level events * RegionManagers to properly display / remove view instances, including memory leak cleanup * Source: [[https://github.com/derickbailey/backbone.marionette]] * Reference application: [[http://bbclonemail.heroku.com]]
title: Backbone.Marionette

description: * Provides mixin classes for a local collections (not stored on a server) and for mixing Backbone.Events into any class (including a check if they are mixed-in). * Provides a facility to use Backbone.Events trigger('destroy') to do memory cleanup instead of a destroy method (event-based instance life-cycles). * [[https://github.com/kmalakoff/mixin]]
title: Mixin.js

description: * Not a JS loader like require.js, but a way to structure your code in big Backbone app projects. * Load JS without worrying about load sequence and dependencies between modules. * Source: [[https://github.com/juggy/backbone-module]]
title: Backbone Module (Module loader for Backbone apps)

description: * [http://fahad19.github.com/singool/](http://fahad19.github.com/singool/) - lightweight framework on top of Backbone for developing single-page web applications.
title: Singool.js

description: * [[https://github.com/dgreisen/Backbone-Traversal]] * Quickly write single-page apps following a hierarchical design pattern.
title: Backbone-Traversal

description: * [[https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/backbone-brace]] * [[http://blogs.atlassian.com/2012/11/add-some-strength-to-your-backbone/]] * Models declare what attributes they expose, and all classes declare what events they expose * Mixins allow mixing in methods / initializers / attributes / events to backbone classes * Lightweight relational structure for creating cascading model / collection hierarchies
title: Backbone.Brace

description: * [[https://github.com/rhysbrettbowen/Backbone.Advice]]
title: Backbone.Advice: Functional mixins for Backbone modules

description: * [[https://github.com/rhysbrettbowen/Nerve]]
title: Nerve: Mediator for application level message passing

description: * [[https://github.com/kendagriff/backbone.analytics]]
title: Backbone.Analytics: Drop-In Google Analytics For Backbone's Router

description: * Homepage: [[http://lorenwest.github.com/backbone-callbacks]] * Github: [[https://github.com/lorenwest/backbone-callbacks]] * Works in the browser and in node.js (commonJS)
title: Backbone-Callbacks: Node.js style callbacks for asynchronous methods
